resources:
Quiz Q1: The Great Khan, once visited by a famed Venetian merchant… Q2: This famous ship once circumnavigated the world, carrying a certain British explorer whose motto was \"Sic Parvis Magna\" (Pick 2 options) Q3: Although widely (and erroneously) credited with its discovery, Christopher Columbus did not contribute to the naming of America. It was actully named after another explorer: Q4: \"The King of Pirates\" was ex-British Navy who in just two short years (1694–96) became the richest pirate in the world, amassing a modern equivalent of over Â£50m. Q5: Legend has it, that \"The King of Pirates\" brought together other captains, forming a utopia of sorts, commonly referred to as… Q6: The flag pictured below, struck fear into anyone unlucky enough to witness it on the ocean. Who did it belong to? Q7: Whilst attempting to complete his monumental circumnavigation of the world, this man, who\'s name is synonymous with exploration, was killed by natives in The Philippines during the Battle of Mactan. Q8: The Santa Maria was the largest of three ships used by which explorer? Answer Here Mary Celeste HMS Endeavour Cutty Sark Golden Hind Marco Polo Sir Francis Drake John Cabot Vasco de Gama Amerigo Vespucci Gonzalez Americo Alfredo Americi America Ferrera //Question 4 variant answers, spinner

Hmm, could do with brushing up on the old \'historia\' Your score was: Not bad, you obviously know some history! Your score was: A venerable Indiana Jones! Your score was: Perfect!!
